direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan takes a pair of overpriced binoculars and looks up -- BINOCULAR POV - FAR UP ON LEDGE The figures are small, but it's clear that one is pointing a gun at an orange-jacketed figure.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: lowers the binoculars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan turns to
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Brett -- you're not going to believe this -- but a couple of guys are holding a gun on Hal and forcing him up the bluff -- BRETT (O.S.) I believe it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: who has found both Heldon's broken body, and his gun, half buried in snow. Evan walks over, amazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brett picks up the gun -- this is more an adventure than he ever dreamed of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brett and Evan grab their packs, and hurry onto a trail, as we return to -- THE UPPER LEDGE where Gabe was. Nothing is stirring. Until, there's some movement ten feet from where Gabe was hugging the wall. It's a crevice in the mountain, about two feet wide -- a climber would call this a "chimney" -- and it's packed with ice and snow. It's also packed with
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the fuck is going on here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's catch up and find out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: his hand gropes out -- and with some difficulty, he digs himself out, gasping and coughing. Gabe, coated with snow, leans against the wall and rests. Alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie is on the phone, pacing, as Frank is slumped in front of the radio scanner. Suddenly, the radio comes to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie bolts over to the radio before Frank can react.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EXT. MOUNTAIN - WOODED AREA - DAY Travers has his gun pressed to Hal's temple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travers yanks away the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travers relents and hands the radio back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: INT. RANGER STATION Maggie looks out the window. The station's windspeed gauge is flying around so fast it looks like it might take off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie leans back in the chair, looks out at the storm, and tries not to worry. She fails miserably.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come in, Rescue Unit -- over --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (keying mike) Rescue Unit -- what's going on, Hall? -- over --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No tricks, no procedural codes, no personal messages -- just tell them everything's under control and you're taking care of the wounded.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (keys it) We've reached the wreckage -- top of Comb Bluff -- six injured, but they're responding to treatment. Everything
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . Over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Everything isn't okay, Hal -- I'm coming up after you -- over -- HAL Negative, Maggie. Winds are too high, and the passengers' injuries are all superficial. We're going to ride out the storm here -- over --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have her come up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget it -- downdrafts would wipe her all over the peaks -- (Travers starts to argue)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not that I expect you to give a shit, but it's our only copter. You'll be stuck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I can handle the winds -- HAL (breaking in) Forget about it, Maggie, that's an order -- acknowledge --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Acknowledged. Let me talk to Gabe -- over -- HAL (O.S.) (hesitates) You can't. He's taking care of passengers. Just like I should be. Over and out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (snatching radio away) Good. You might live longer than your friend. Now -- (takes out monitor)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hal takes the monitor -- the next blip is above, almost straight up. Hal motions to the wooded area ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travers digests this, and motions Hal to move on as we -- CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The next one's on top of the peak. This'll be long, but easy -- more like a hike than a climb.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (suspicious) It looks like a winding route.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a more direct route. The East Face. But it's the wall on the other side, and it's smooth as glass. Maybe a dozen guys in the world could do it in good weather. Only a psycho would try it in a snowstorm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is torn in pain. In spite of the cold and wind, he's drenched in sweat, half exertion, half fear. We pull back to take in
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LONG SHOT Envision a wall. A really big wall. A really, really big wall. A wall that's as wide as it is high -- five thousand feet by five thousand feet -- narrowing to a domed peak at the summit. Now picture the same wall, checkered with ice. If this were horizontal, you or I couldn't walk on it without falling. Now picture the same wall with an orange dot, two-thirds of the way up it. The orange dot is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and he barely has the strength to hold on, much less go up. Gabe holds himself steady with one hand, gets a foothold, and swings another hand up to SLAM it against the wall. He's improvised gear -- he's tied a crampon to one hand. But it's as awkward as it sounds. Gabe moves up only a foot or so
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then pulls out the crampon, reaches up, and SLAMS it into the wall, starting the painful process over again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wright's pacing around, trying to figure out what in his office he should break first. Davis shows up at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He points to a huge part of Colorado. Hundreds of square miles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wright slumps into a chair.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (furious) Okay -- I know it's not in San Francisco. I know it's not here. I know it's not in any fucking airport from here to Montana. Where it's not - we got that covered. Now, do you have any ideas on where it is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (walking to a map) There's no radio contact, sir. At all. We're not receiving the tracer signal from the cockpit's flight recorder. Radar lost it after it went low here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have to assume it went down in the storm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Air search?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shakes head) That storm hasn't quit yet. Weather service says we've got it until tomorrow morning at least. Even if we could get a plane up now, it'd be impossible to see anything on the ground. And --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The roads are shut down, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Most of this area doesn't even have roads.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rubs his eyes) Keep two copters on full standby. And let me know the second that storm starts to wind down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - DAY - GABE is clearly exhausted and freezing -- his lips are blue, his eyebrows encrusted with snow. Wind still threatens to knock him off the wall -- but he forces himself on.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (teeth chattering) A steambath. (spikes himself up) A steambath -- and a bottle of whiskey. (new foothold) A steambath with a bottle of Glenlivet. And a fire. (new handhold) A steambath -- with a bottle of Glenlivet -- and a steak. (new foothold) A steak soaked with Glenlivet, cooking over a steambath on fire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R ON MOUNTAIN Gabe finally reaches the top of the wall, where it meets an enormous overhang of ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is right underneath where the ice flows over the wall. Gabe takes his handheld crampon and hammers it into the ice overhead with more force than usual. This one is going to have to hold. Gabe steels himself for a tough move -- with one hand gripping that crampon, he swings out, away from the wall. Only the crampon spikes jammed into the ice above his hand are keeping Gabe from falling. Gabe needs the second crampon to make the move up -- but that's not going to be easy to get. It's attached to his boot. As Gabe clings to the upper crampon, his body swaying, he reaches down with his free hand to loosen the other crampon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ground is one slip and five thousand feet away. Gabe fumbles desperately with the buckles on the crampons -- but both his fingers, and the buckles, are frozen stiff -- GABE'S FACE shows real, solid terror for the first time -- GABE'S POV - DOWN Gabe gets the first buckle off -- then the second. The crampon is off his boot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: still swinging from one hand, takes the now-freed crampon and slams it into the ice. It doesn't hold -- but the force of Gabe's swing, pushing him away, has loosened the other crampon. Gabe only gets one more shot at this -- he swings the free crampon up with all his might -- it catches in the same split second as the other dislodges. But the hard part is over -- with the two crayons, Gabe quickly manages to climb up over the lip of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a field of ice sloping up to the top. Gabe pulls himself a few feet away from the edge, and puts the crampons back on his feet where they belong. It's now pretty simple for Gabe to run up the ice slope three hundred yards to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: which is a rocky, wooded area. Gabe seems to have a second wind now -- he runs to the other side of the summit. The other side is obviously the route Hal and the others will be taking -- beneath the summit is a winding, well-beaten path. Gabe finally arrives at a small shack with a sign nearby commemorating the "DOUGLAS EXPEDITION - 1933".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is just a small "point of interest" shed for hardy tourists who have hiked up this far -- there is a corny photo stand, where you stick your head through a hole, so your face is put on top of a cartoon climber hacking up a mountain. Gabe rushes past this to a glass display case on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has black and white photos of a square jawed 1930s climber with his expedition -- more important is what's beneath it. Douglas' original climbing equipment -- a coil of rope, some pitons, a hat, a cloth backpack, small binoculars, other odds and ends. Gabe prepares to smash the glass -- and hesitates. Respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe SMASHES the glass as we move to -- EXT. THE TRAIL - DAY Hal is leading Qualen, Travers and the others upward -- this is a comparatively easy route, but still tiring. The sun goes down beyond a facing, taller mountain. Ryan is huffing and puffing -- the altitude and exertion are getting to him. Hal allows himself a smile at his discomfort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Qualen pokes Hal with the gun -- he moves on ahead.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (sighing) Sorry, Gordon -- I promise I'll have it back tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on -- tourists take this trail.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's getting dark rapidly -- Gabe has scaled a rock formation so he has a view of the rest of the summit -- GABE'S POV - SCANNING THE TREELINE Gabe slowly looks along the trees of the summit -- looks pretty ordinary to us, but something must have caught Gabe's eye, because he swings back to look at one tree. With broken branches on top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: climbs down from his rock perch and rushes toward the tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This "expedition" reaches the top -- Hal is in the lead, with Qualen just inches behind. Qualen shoves Hal forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travers takes out the tracer and starts following the blip.

dialogue.raw_text: Is this it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. This is it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good. Get out of the way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - GABE frantically rushes around, looking for the case -- he spots a crater of snow, rushes to it and starts digging. Even below the snow, the tracer's blinking red light is glowing and visible. Gabe laughs as he digs it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - TRAVERS has his eyes glued to the tracer monitor, which shows the case is nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Qualen shines a light -- all of them push their way through the trees.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) This way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is excited now -- he can't even wait for Qualen's flashlight, he intuitively races through the trees, dividing his attention between his surroundings and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: which shows he's practically on top of the case -- finally
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shoves his way through some small pines -- he can see the blinking of the red tracer light ahead through the branches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travers shoves his way through the branches, and heads for the light -- but something's wrong -- Qualen comes up behind Travers and shines the light on
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling behind) It's over here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: cute, if hastily constructed, stands with a five-pebble smile, as well as Douglas' cap, in a clearing. The still blinking, still operable tracer is now the nose of the snowman. The case is leaned up against it. Travers runs over to the case, furious, and opens it. It's empty -- except for a single $5000 bill. Travers picks it up -- scrawled on the margin is "LET'S TRADE."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Qualen, Kynette, Delmer and Krystel fan out into the woods, each with a flashlight and a fun. Ryan, however, straps on nightfinder goggles and runs out without a flashlight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (incredulous) He's still alive. (furious) He's still alive! (to Qualen and the others) He can't be far away -- spread out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hal, brandishing gun) Put your hands on your head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - GABE watches the chaos with a grin from a slightly elevated vantage point -- he can see the flashlight beams, all headed in the wrong direction. But he doesn't see
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - "NIGHTFINDER" POV With these goggles, light is amplified a thousandfold -- this isn't one of those infra-red, thermo-blob jobs -- it looks more like day for night photography. Even starlight is enough for Ryan to run easily through the thick woods -- and he's going in the right direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: begins climbing down to level ground so he can circle closer to where Travers is holding Hal -- before he can get far -- "NIGHTFINDER" POV - RYAN looks up, and can clearly see Gabe climbing down the small rock, twenty yards distant -- RYAN smiles, looking macabre under the goggles, and opens fire -- GABE is startled as the bullets impact inches over his head -- he jumps the last ten feet to the ground and is running even as he hits the ground -- more bullets hit where Gabe was a split second ago -- RYAN chases Gabe, easily maneuvering through the trees -- GABE runs too, trying to dodge Ryan's continuing fusillades -- Gabe knows this territory, but to him, it's still pitch dark -- he stumbles, and rams against trees -- RYAN keeps coming up behind, closing the hap, Gabe's bright form just ahead -- GABE comes out of the trees and finds he is on another part of the summit. All that's beneath him is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- a sudden, sloping plunge down a field of ice. No escape route here -- anything that goes down this slide is going all the way to the ground far below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is driven forward by a fresh burst of bullets -- he dives to the edge of the ice field and ducks behind a boulder -- the sole source of cover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kristel, Qualen and Kynette, having heard the gunshots, are now rushing to Gabe's position -- RYAN almost casually emerges from the woods. He can see there is nowhere for Gabe to have gone -- except behind the boulder. He walks toward it as if he had all the time in the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fumbles in his backpack and pulls out something from the Douglas exhibit -- an ancient flare that looks like a can of sterno. Gabe pulls out his lighter and tries to light it -- it resists and looks like a dud, but finally it catches, and as it ignites Gabe heaves it over the boulder at Ryan -- RYAN - "NIGHTFINDER" POV - THE FLARE arcs over the boulder to fully ignite, turning everything into a blinding, agonizing flash of white -- RYAN SCREAMS, putting one hand over the goggles, trying to rip them off -- GABE bolts out from behind the boulder to rush him -- RYAN instantly aware of what Gabe's doing, blindly shoots, fanning out in a semi-circle as he gets the goggles off -- GABE just runs straight ahead to Ryan, getting to him before the machine gun field of fire can intersect his path -- Gabe tackles Ryan as he manages to get the goggles off -- both men fall to the ground, and -- The machine gun CLATTERS away, landing on the edge of the ice, just out of reach -- Ryan, now recovered from the blinding flash, pulls an ice axe out of a pack sheath and swings it at Gabe -- Gabe rolls away in time, and gets to the machine gun, grabbing it -- But Ryan dives for Gabe, slamming into him -- the force of it knocks the machine gun loose -- it skips down the ice slope -- but the momentum of Ryan's hit also carries both Gabe and Ryan over the edge, onto -- THE ICE SLOPE Gabe and Ryan both tumble over the edge and start sliding down, Ryan face first on his stomach, Gabe head first and on his back -- both are in immediate agony, because
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it's covered with razor sharp, irregular ridges, both large and small, that slice through clothing and shred skin as they pick up speed -- GABE'S UPSIDE-DOWN POV - THE ICE FIELD The edge and a five thousand foot drop are less than a hundred yards away -- GABE AND RYAN SLIDING Ryan flails and SCREAMS as the ice gashes him from underneath -- Gabe, however, manages to flip over and to the side -- he lunges on top of Ryan and rides him down like a bobsled -- GABE'S POV - END OF THE ICE SLOPS is coming up too fast -- GABE tries to maintain his perch on Ryan, who is SCREAMING and not yet used to the idea of being a human sled -- he isn't remaining still enough to provide a smooth ride -- Gabe frantically reaches behind to Ryan's wrist to get the ice axe, trailing from a wrist strap, but Ryan's arm is thrashing away, threatening to toss off the axe -- ON SUMMIT Qualen, Kristel and Kynette arrive at the lip, and look down, incredulous -- QUALEN POV - GABE RIDING RYAN Gabe and Ryan, accelerating, have almost reached the edge -- GABE finally grabs the ice axe, pulling it off Ryan's wrist -- just as they reach the precipice edge, Gabe loops the axe to his wrist and swings toward the ice with everything he's got -- The axe's scythe-like blade catches on the ice, right at the lip of the precipice -- Gabe is wrenched to a painful halt, suspended over the drop, as what's left of Ryan, still
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shoots over the edge -- Gabe unhooks the axe, and gets another handhold. Gabe uses the axe to climb further down the ice to some rock -- finding easier hand holds, he quickly disappears into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: look down -- Ryan's death scream is still echoing. Qualen is furious -- Gabe has escaped with the second case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kynette shines his flashlight below, illuminating the long, frozen streak of blood on the ice.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Kynette) Follow him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gestures with light) After you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The expedition has holed up here for the night -- Travers and Qualen look upset. Things aren't going as well as they'd hoped. Kristel tries to get some candy out of a vending machine that's obviously empty. Kynette saws at some camp food with a distinctive knife -- the handle is a set of brass knuckles. Delmer guards Hal, who is bound, and seated by the souvenir photo stand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well -- look at the bright side. (beat) At least you've only got to make the split five ways now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gabe confidently drops down onto a large ledge that juts out from the wall -- obviously familiar territory for him. The ledge leads to a small, enclosed cave. Gabe takes out his penlight and shines it -- but the light looks dim. Batteries are low. Gabe pockets it, flicks his lighter and goes in -- THE CAVE in the flickering light, we can see that no one has been in here for a while -- snow, dust, rocks -- but we should also recognize this from the photo seen earlier as Gabe, Maggie and Hal's hangout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles with the memories -- then his face brightens with one memory in particular. Gabe rushes to a corner of the cave and opens a rock-lid to a hiding place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe reaches in the stash and finds an ancient half-full pint of Jack Daniels. The first thing to go right all day. Gabe uncaps it and gratefully gulps down a double shot. Peace, at last. Gabe smiles and leans against the wall, closing his eyes
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Please still be there -- oh, please --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: but he's startled instantly by a SCREECH -- Gabe's eyes shoot open -- An aggressive rat scurries toward him on the floor. Gabe grabs a rock and CLOBBERS the rat off-screen, ending the screeches with one blow. Gabe's face first registers disgust -- then an idea. Then real disgust. Sighing, Gabe pulls out a pocket knife and opens the blade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A LITTLE LATER - CLOSE ON GABE Gabe takes the now cooked rat carcass -- properly skinned and butchered -- off his knife blade. We can see from flickering shadows that a small fire is now burning in a cave -- we pull back to see
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: which is built out of small bundles of $5,000 bills. It's safe to say that something like $500,000 is going up in smoke, and the fire's dying down. Gabe tosses a fresh band of bills on the flame. Gabe cools the knife in some snow, saws off a rat leg, and chews unhappily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe sparingly washes the bite down with a taste of Jack Daniel. It's going to have to last him. He has an entire rat to get through.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (mouth full) Mmm. Just like -- chicken.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . WIDE MOUNTAIN VIEW - DAWN The first rays of the sun start to poke through the mountains. It's stopped snowing -- the storm seems to be letting up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very quiet in here. Frank is snoring, slumped over the radio. Maggie is wide awake and obviously hasn't slept -- her attention is fixed out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gauge is still flying around, but clearly shows that the winds are slowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wright is coiled at his desk, tense. Ten empty styrofoam coffee cups -- and dark rings under Wright's eyes -- make clear he hasn't slept. Wright's assistant bursts in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wright drags the protesting Davis out the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We've got a fix on the plane, sir -- we're getting a reading on the flight recorder tracer -- WRIGHT Any visual? Any radio contact?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not yet -- WRIGHT (heading to the door) Get the copters ready. We take off in three minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The winds are still too strong -- WRIGHT Sorry to hear it. We're still going. The plane might be intact.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir -- WRIGHT Shut up. That fifty million isn't coming out of my pension.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Travers, Qualen and the rest of the expedition head out of the shack, a little groggy. Odds are no one got much sleep. Travers shoves Hal toward a sketchy "YOU ARE HERE" map of the mountain range, and hands him the tracer monitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hal matches the monitor to the map -- the blip is higher up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travers shoves Hal forward -- the others follow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Still interested in staying alive?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing to map) It's up here. Somewhere on the Tower. There's a way to cross over to the top in about half a day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Show me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - BINOCULAR POV From about fifty yards off, someone watches Hal lead the gang away from the shack.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) They're heading toward the opposite edge. An easy way down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: are crouched in the woods. Brett, gun in hand, has no idea how far out of his league he is. Evan looks like he's having second thoughts, but he can't hack down now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brett, automatic held high, circles off through the woods. Evan reluctantly lopes off toward his assignment.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'll cut around this side, and wind up in front. You come up behind them -- quietly. And we've got 'em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Brett -- they've got five guns -- BRETT And you can collect them all after I get the drop on 'em. Let's get moving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - GABE'S CAVE Gabe pulls his jacket on -- reversed, with the grey lining out, so the orange won't make him so easy to spot -- and starts out towards the facing Tower -- his route, clearly, is going to be along the rock wall. It's relatively sheer, but there are shelves cut into it to make walking easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BRETT races quietly through the woods in a parallel path with Hal, who's guiding the hang. Brett circles around ahead of them, waiting. Before he can jump out -- HAL'S POV - ON BRETT hiding ahead in the trees and rocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: makes eye contact with Brett, realizes what he's doing, and shakes his head as violently as he dares -- no, don't -- BRETT gives Hal a confident wink in response, then pounces in front of the gang, gun held high.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travers, Delmer, Kristel and Kynette are startled, but don't immediately comply. This throws Brett off his stride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travers smiles and steps closer to Brett. The others walk up in front of Hal. Travers actually laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brett doesn't even look down -- he responds by FIRING a short burst over Travers' head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All drop their guns -- Brett, unfortunately, realizes at the same time we do -- BRETT Hey -- where's the other guy -- HAL (shouting) Brett, behind you! Too late -- Brett can only twist around half way before -- QUALEN easily mows down Brett with his machine gun, riddling him with at least thirty rounds at close range. Brett falls dead into the snow. Qualen walks up to Brett's corpse, blood steaming in the reddening snow, and kicks it over.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: End of the line!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nervous now) You heard me! Drop the guns!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "End of the line"? That's classic. (beat) You've got style. So, I'm going to give you a three-count to figure out how to turn the safety off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nice try. I've got one of these at home. Now drop 'em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gabe, reacting to the sound of the machine gun fire, climbs up, but there's nothing he can do -- TRAVERS AND QUALEN and the others pick up their guns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travers sees that Hal is gone -- he's escaped in the confusion.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (turning to face Hal) Time to --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - HAL runs like his ass is on fire and practically collides with Evan, who is more panicked than ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan snatches the parachute and runs off. Hal, wasting no time, runs in the opposite direction, deliberately making as much noise as he can, slapping branches, stomping on rocks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are we going to do -- HAL You came up here to jump the spur -- (pulls Evan's chute out of his pack) This'd be a great time to do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (panicked) But -- HAL (quick) Listen -- they don't know you're up here -- I'll draw their fire, you've got to make the jump and get help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't -- I -- uh -- HAL (exasperated, grabs chute) Unless you want to do it the other way around?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: runs into the woods -- Qualen and Kristel, hearing Hal's noisy retreat, run after him.  But Travers stops for a second -- he has spotted
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the snow -- not unlike a neon arrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: runs in the direction of the footprints and quickly closes the gap between him and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who tries to pull on the chute and run at the same time -- it's not easy. Evan closes one of the three buckles -- but
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bursts out of the woods and runs up right behind him -- QUALEN AND KRISTEL in the meantime, get behind Hal in a clearing -- Kristel FIRES over his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hal, caught again, freezes in his tracks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stop!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is still up and running -- he dodges Travers' fire, weaving through trees, getting the second buckle closed -- he sees the edge, just ahead, and puts on an extra burst of speed -- TRAVERS does likewise, still firing -- his clip runs out, but this only buys Evan an extra few seconds -- THE SPUR is a rock formation that just out like a diving board -- Evan runs like hell to the edge of it -- TRAVERS is right behind him, and has slapped a fresh clip in place, but before he can shoot -- EVAN dives off the edge and clasps the third buckle -- ON THE LEDGE - GABE is directly below a few hundred feet -- looking up, he thinks Evan has made it -- but
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - TRAVERS throws himself down, aims quickly but carefully, and FIRES twenty rounds towards Evan's falling figure -- EVAN - FALLING Evan LAUGHS -- he hasn't been hit -- GABE - WATCHING GABE Come on -- wait till you're out of range -- don't pull it yet -- LONG SHOT - EVAN FALLING Several seconds pass -- Evan is now several hundred feet down and apparently out of firing range -- TRAVERS stops firing -- but doesn't seem unhappy at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: more and pulls the D-ring -- the parachute billows open, inflating -- CLOSE ON THE PARACHUTE which has been shredded by bullets that hit the pack -- as quickly as it inflates, it deflates through dozens of holes -- whatever resistance is left vanishes as the canopy collapses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: exhilaration turns to panic as he frantically pulls on the chute's guide lines -- but the more he does this, the faster the chute caves in -- he SCREAMS as the chute finally gives way and plummets right past
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who is powerless to do anything but watch -- EVAN falls the long, full five thousand feet, desperately, uselessly, pulling in the lines of the tattered chute until he's tangled in it like a shroud -- GABE turns away -- he can't watch Evan hit bottom -- he grimaces and looks up with absolute hate at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who doesn't see Gabe -- he's laughing at Evan's desperation, which ends as his death scream is cut off. Hal is led over to the spur, with the other gang members behind him. Hal looks as angry as Gabe.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Was that Walker?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No such luck. (to Hal, smiling) Cheer up. Everyone should die in a spot this beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - CLOSE ON GABE who has heard this and is shaking with fury.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Don't worry. You will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: On top, Hal reluctantly leads the gang away -- below, we can see Gabe start out on a parallel path along the ledges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winds or not, Maggie is untying the helicopter's rotor from the bolts on the helipad. Frank, who has obviously just awakened, rushes out of the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie gets into the helicopter and starts the rotor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank hesitates, but climbs in the other side. The helicopter lifts off and heads toward the mountain range.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maggie -- what are you doing -- MAGGIE I'm going to go nuts if I sit here one more hour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Still a little breezy out, Mag --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (over engine's whine) You coming?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The next obstacle Hal is leading the gang through is a buttress -- a large, stark boulder formation -- that lays between the mountain they've just come from, and the nearest mountain to it: the Tower. This is lower down from the summit -- it's solid and treeless. Hal and the rest of the expedition is totally exposed as they climb in single file up to the top. Terrain is flat enough that the climb amount to an uphill run on all fours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ON HAL AND GANG Hal leads the gang forward -- and keeps casting anxious glances back at them. And beyond them. Travers notices this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hal looks back. Travers is right. There's absolutely no way Gabe can come up behind them without being seen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Forget about it. He's smart, but he's not invisible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: where the bluff meets a tree-lined plain. Gabe, in hiding, watches Hal and the others go up. No, he can't follow them up the bluff's side without being seen. But Gabe moves closer to the bluff's base -- Gabe shoves through some trees to the beginning of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A crevice runs the entire length and breadth of the bluff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulls out his ancient binoculars, and scans the crack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Starting with an outside view, we can see that the crevice runs all the way up, and through, the bluff -- but it's a zig-zag, not a straight line. Picture a mine shaft designed by a madman. The crack moves upward, then erratically to the side, then straight up again. The width of the crack is uneven, ranging from six inches to six feet. And that's just how it looks on the outside. There's no telling what the interior is like. Gabe turns the binoculars to the inside of the crack. It's hard to see much -- it's very, very dark. But it looks as if the crack goes all the way through the bluff, as well as all the way up it. On this route, Gabe can tunnel through the mountain instead of going up the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: puts away the binoculars and wedges himself into the crack, starting the long process of going up -- and through -- the mountain formation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A frenzy of activity, as several dozen Treasury agents sift through the snow for the wreckage of the CT-39, some taking photos, some taking videotapes, some putting the pieces into bags for analysis. Many bags. Many small bags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ON CRASH SITE The Treasury plane has been completely pulverized by the crash and its subsequent explosion -- there are few pieces here that aren't charred, and fewer still that are any larger than a paperback book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: unhappily walks through the carnage and past agents gathering up the plane, to a harried crash specialist from the FAA -- ROSS STUART (40s) -- who is organizing the debris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks away -- but Wright, pissed, spins him around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wright storms off as agents delicately handle debris.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What can you confirm?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, sir -- it crashed. That, I can confirm. (condescending) We've been here just about one hour. These events take months to analyze. So if you'll excuse me --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I don't think I will. The reason the FAA pays you is to exercise your vast, amazing knowledge of these "events". So I expect you to come up with some stunning insights, something a slow-witted fuck like me hasn't already observed. (gesturing to wreckage) One: it didn't blow up in mid-air, because the debris isn't widely dispersed. But was there a bomb on board that could have disabled it? I wonder. (pointing back) Two: There wasn't an attempted landing. Otherwise, there'd be debris to the east of the wreckage, where the plane was coming from. Did it come straight down? That's got me scratching my head too. (gesturing back to wreckage) And three: the flight recorder's tracer led us here in the first place. So where is the goddamn thing? That one's got me all aflush with curiosity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a little cowed) You'll be the first to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I believe you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A vista. From this point, you can see everything else in the mountain range. The only thing left that's taller is the Tower, a hundred yards away. Between the two mountains lies a drop of a mere four thousand feet. Hal has led the rest of the gang up to the edge. Travers approaches him, furious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hal points
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you said there was an easy way across.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is. You might not like it much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A steep two hundred yard downhill climb leads to a wire that bridges the two mountains. The same wire we saw at the beginning -- left behind from Susan Collins' botched rescue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - HAL AND TRAVERS HAL Of course -- we'll have to do it hand over hand. Seems I forgot my harness. Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hal is surprised to see Kynette pull a harness out of his pack
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be. Lead on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: the one Travers used earlier. Disappointed, Hal leads the downward climb, looking several hundred yards to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: running up, and through, the bluff, coming out on this side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: registers a thought -- will he? -- then dismissal. Nah. He couldn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe is sweating, straining in the dark, climbing up -- this'd be a good spot to pull back and take in the view, except -- THE CHIMNEY -- there's nowhere to pull back to. There's about two inches of clearance between Gabe's chest and the rock, and about the same between his back and the rock. To the right, there is no light. At all. To the left, there's no light. Even above, there is no light, because the crack isn't straight -- nature isn't that obliging -- it zig-zags up. Gabe is well within the mountain rock. Nothing could be closer to being buried alive Gabe snakes through a spot where the crack goes straight up -- he takes out his penlight and turns it on -- GABE'S POV - INSIDE THE CRACK AROUND HIM even this dim light reveals scores of bats hanging on the wall, surrounding him, up and down, left and right -- GABE'S FACE is stuck somewhere between nausea and the realization that he's made a big mistake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe cuts the light and slithers up through the dark.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't need to see that. I really didn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Maggie and Frank are flying low and fast, over treetops and snow -- both are intently staring down -- THEIR VIEW is nothing but empty wilderness. But a BUZZER goes off -- MAGGIE AND FRANK turn their attention to the helicopter's heat scope, which shows something alive beneath them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie smiles and slows the copter over a clearing -- EXT. WOODS/THE COPTER touches down. Maggie is out of it before the rotor has stopped turning, running into the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie runs into the trees, headlong into
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Got 'em -- they're under the trees --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hal! Gabe!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: that are preying on -- a body. A pair of legs are gruesomely sticking out from the feast. One wolf turns to SNARL at Maggie
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but Frank runs up and pulls a gun from a holster. Frank aims high and FIRES twice to scare the pack -- the wolves run off. Maggie goes to the body -- Frank holds her back, but she goes ahead anyway, worried it might be Gabe -- TIGHT ON MAGGIE as she examines the body -- MAGGIE It's Evan. (she stands, looks up) Parachute failed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (not unkindly) Damn fool. Why would anybody try that in the middle of a storm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why would anybody try at all. (sighs) Get the bag.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gabe has a quick climbing rhythm now. He pulls himself up with his hands, then braces his body with his back, and pulls himself up again -- he's not looking up, because he can't see anything yet anyway -- naturally, this leads to -- A head and rock collision. Gabe's head crashes against a new part of the crack, as the passage thins out. He gropes up. The passage is narrowing to the point that he can't get through it. Dead end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe backs down, and starts to slide across the side. With his back wedged against the rear wall, he uses his feet to push against the forward wall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Should've taken that left turn at Albequerque.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Zero visibility -- Gabe can't see what he's shoving toward. There has never been light of any kind in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: blindly pushes to the side, rattled by the difficulty of doing this in the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe stops and fishes out his penlight. Turning it on, it's clear those batteries haven't gotten any more potent in the last few hours. Gabe shines it to the side.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's just like any other side move -- you can't see where the fuck you're going, that's all --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is fading fast. A match's last gasp is brighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: exasperated, puts the penlight in his mouth and moves on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe inches on to the side. Looks up to see if the crack has gotten wider. It hasn't. Gabe mumbles something phonetically near "motherfucker" around the flashlight, aiming it up -- GABE'S POV - UP No opening larger than a mail slot -- GABE still cursing, still looking up, still moving to the side -- he gets the opening he wants, but not where he wants it -- The crack suddenly, drastically widens as he moves to the side -- since he's been bracing his back against the wall, Gabe falls out of control, twisting around, face down -- Gabe bounces down the walls for several yards and catches himself by bracing his arms and legs against the crack. It's now five feet wide as he painfully brakes himself -- GABE'S POV - THE PENLIGHT falls out of Gabe's mouth and tumbles down, ping-ponging from one side of the crack to the other as it tumbles a long, long way down -- even after the light is gone, we can still hear the penlight's receding clattering against the walls -- GABE is now, literally, in a jam. There are no handholds, no ledges, and the walls are slick. All he can do is remain braced against the crack's walls until his already sore arms and legs give out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (garbled) Much better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Frank is now flying the helicopter -- a body bag is stashed in the back, and Maggie is in the passenger seat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (motioning down) Bring it down here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maggie -- MAGGIE Just do it, Frank.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The copter touches down -- Frank doesn't turn it off. Maggie jumps out with a walkie talkie. Frank makes another try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie runs off into the snow as Frank lifts off. Maggie moves quickly through the snow, and it isn't long before she spots multiple tracks in the snow -- they lead toward, and up, the buttress. Now she's really confused. But with nothing left to do, she starts climbing up the side.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maggie, this is dumb -- MAGGIE No it isn't. I'm going to find Brett -- I don't want to have to talk to his widow too. Fly Evan's body back to base -- I'll call you when I've found Brett. Or Hal. Or Gabe. Or anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As we've caught Hal in mid-crossing, he's looking from whence he came -- the opposite side of the buttress, where Travers has a gun trained on him -- HAL unhappily hangs high above the ground from the harness kindly provided by Travers -- HAL'S POV - ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE WIRE Kristel is waiting, also with a gun trained on him. Hal arrives and disengages -- the harness is pulled back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kynette pulls the harness back and hands it to Qualen, who's standing next to Travers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kynette, automatic strapped to his chest, rushes back to the buttress' summit.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (motioning up) I'm going back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look -- this part is nothing, believe me -- KYNETTE Walker should be coming up by now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gabe is just as we left him. Face down, arms and legs pressing against the five-foot gap of the tunnel walls. Carefully, Gabe takes one hand off the wall, gets out his lighter with the other, and ignites it for a look -- GABE'S POV - UPWARD Just as the crack has widened below him -- it's wider above him. More important, it slants at an easy enough angle to allow him to walk up. If only he can get up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: snaps the lighter shut, pockets it, and readies himself. Gabe steadily "walks" up the vertical passage by bracing himself with one leg and one arm -- then moving the other leg and arm up. Gabe repeats this until he has his hands on the curved edge where the crack snakes into a sideways passage. But there are no handholds that will allow Gabe to get a grip and simply swing over and climb up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (winded) So much for the easy part.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gabe takes a deep breath, readies himself, and shoves himself away from the wall with his arms, pushes himself into a squat against the opposite wall, hanging for a second with no support at all, and he springs from that all into
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe lands hard but flat on the passage and immediately starts backsliding into the drop, but he digs in with his boots and his hands. Safe at last. Gabe carefully stands in a crouch -- and starts heading up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kynette moves to the edge, lies flat, and looks down -- KYNETTE'S POV - ON THE BUTTRESS SIDE Maggie is climbing up, but she's still some way down -- and the hood of her parka has been pulled over her head. All Kynette can see is what she's wearing: an orange parka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles and hits his headset radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kynette flattens out to wait -- Maggie is coming up fast.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He's on the way up. I could hear that jacket before I could see it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (over radio) Then get the money, kill him and get back here. Now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into radio) I'll wait till he comes to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gabe moves up through the diagonal section -- the crack is starting to go directly upward. Gabe looks up -- GABE'S POV - TOP OF THE CRACK It's coated with snow, but not too much -- Gabe can faintly make out light shining through up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: knows the top is twenty feet away. Gabe starts up the easy segment, his back braced against one wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is staring down intently at the climber below -- KYNETTE'S POV - MAGGIE is now almost to the top -- sweating with exertion, she throws her hood back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: keys his headset radio again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into radio) Bulletin. The climber isn't Walker -- it's a woman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gabe, wedged near the top of the crack, is ready to dig through the snow -- but he hears the sound, muffled and distant, of Kynette talking. Gabe strains to hear -- a bad time to come up? Might be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie, tired, gets near the top and collapses, resting for a moment, her arms on the edge -- Maggie looks up and is very surprised to see Kynette, standing over her, smiling, his gun aimed down at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie stares up, frozen -- whatever she was expecting, it wasn't this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Kynette tightens his finger around the trigger -- GABE appears -- he completes his run toward Kynette's back and kicks him over the edge -- KYNETTE goes flying over Maggie, his shots going wild -- but he catches himself on the rock and comes to a painful but safe halt after skidding down ten feet -- GABE yanks Maggie to her feet and onto the top. Maggie gets a good look at Gabe -- his clothes are slashed, he's covered with cuts, and coated with slime and dirt from the crack. He looks like he's just spent a week in Hell. Gabe doesn't react to her reaction -- he just grabs her hand and runs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Rotten weather for a climb, huh? (aims barrel) I have two questions I'd like to trouble you with. Ready?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This first one's easy. Do you know a man named Gabe Walker?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. (breathless, scared) Where is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't know either? I am sorry. That was question number two. (lowers barrel) Thanks for your time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: chooses this moment to show up at the opposite edge -- he fires and automatic BURST at Gabe and Maggie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe jumps on a spot in the snow over the crack, caving it in -- Gabe falls two feet into
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come on -- MAGGIE Where? -- GABE Here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - MAGGIE'S POV Gabe has grabbed, and is hanging from, a rope anchored to a piton on the edge of the rock. He's also glowering up at Maggie a little impatiently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe rappels down the rope into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Today, goddamit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: hesitates -- she's still getting used to the idea of being shot at -- KYNETTE woozy but recovered, has climbed up -- he runs toward the opening, FIRING his gun -- MAGGIE drops into the relative safety of the crack and rappels downward. Maggie reaches rope's end thirty feet down, as the vertical passage again becomes diagonal. Gabe is there waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reaches the edge of the crack and FIRES down into it -- GABE AND MAGGIE - FURTHER DOWN -- bullets are RICOCHETING all over -- Gabe throws himself over Maggie to shield her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: can't see what he's shooting at, so he mercifully stops. Seeing the rope, he bends down to climb after them -- GABE AND MAGGIE - FURTHER DOWN Gabe reaches up and tugs gently on the rope twice -- KYNETTE - REACHING FOR THE ROPE -- which is tied in a standard climber's slipknot and comes undone with a final tug -- the rope, freed of the piton, falls down, but Kynette firmly grabs hold of the end -- GABE feels the rope go taut -- he yanks the rope down hard -- KYNETTE gets more pull than he counted on and takes a head first fall into the crack, disappearing with a scream -- Qualen has just arrived in time to see this -- GABE looks over as Kynette bounces past him, a few feet away -- the rope goes slack in his hand as Kynette falls below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - QUALEN in frustration, FIRES a burst straight down into the crack -- GABE AND MAGGIE - IN THE CRACK/CHIMNEY Gabe and Maggie move laterally through the crack -- now about thirty feet from where they started, so ricochets are a serious but decreasing problem. The crack narrows from five to three feet. Gabe edges Maggie down into it, and along a ledge moving to the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe and Maggie move along the ledge -- QUALEN is still at the edge of the crack -- stymied. He's definitely not climbing down after them -- he pulls back from the edge.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This way. (off Maggie's look) I like the outside of the mountain better too, but --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - GABE AND MAGGIE find a comparative point of comfort -- a toe-sized ledge. Maggie is moving ahead of Gabe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exhausted, Gabe braces himself against the wall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We can't -- GABE I need to stop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looks at Maggie) I'm glad to see you -- but Christ, I wish you hadn't come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Qualen whizzes across the wire on the harness, easily making it to where Hal, Travers and Kristel are waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travers takes a couple of heavy swings at the connecting bolt with Hal's axe. Qualen grabs his arm before he can take a third swing -- and looks at his watch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't tell me -- QUALEN (disengaging) He's still alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For another two minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - GABE AND MAGGIE Gabe catches his breath. All this is taking its toll on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EXT. TOWER FACE - DAY Hal is leading the expedition upward along a ledge -- the radio, in Travers' pack, comes to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travers stares daggers at Qualen. Qualen looks to his watch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It hurts just looking at you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (still panting) Try it from this side. Do you still have your radio?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not going to work in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's give it a try. (she hands it to him) I'm in bad need of a ride. (keys it) Come in, Rescue Unit --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (over radio)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come in, Rescue One --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Patience.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The radio is reading Gabe loud, if not clear -- the interference of solid rock is garbling it. But we can see out the window that Frank is now between radios, carefully hauling Evan's body from the helicopter to the station on a collapsible gurney. No one else is in the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: INT. BUTTRESS CRACK/CHIMNEY Gabe, exasperated, stops for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie shakes her head no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TOP OF BUTTRESS - HIGH ANGLE We can see there are three holes punched in the snow along the crack's top -- CLOSER ON ONE OF THE HOLES Recognizably the part of the crack Gabe and Maggie dove into -- but perched on the edge is a block of plastic explosive -- the detonator LED races down -- 0:20 -- 0:19 -- A SECOND HOLE has been punched in the snow at the center point of the crevice's top -- another bomb has been planted there -- A THIRD HOLE at the opposite end of the crevice has a third timer tied to a third pack of plastics -- EXT. TOWER FACE Qualen is staring at his watch, but pointing the others toward the buttress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe's radio calls continue as Qualen extends his arm towards the buttress and starts a silent hand countdown, stage manager style -- five -- four -- three -- INSERT - TIMER The LED runs down -- 0:02 -- 0:01 -- THE BUTTRESS TOP is shattered by a huge blast as the first bomb detonates -- INSIDE THE CRACK/CHIMNEY The walls are pulverized near the top and cave in, raining rocks further down towards -- GABE AND MAGGIE who are hit by a blast of air booming down through the confined space -- Gabe drops the radio -- Maggie slips, but Gabe grabs her -- both slide down the crack, out of control, until it narrows to a three foot width -- and they stop -- Gabe shoves Maggie against the wall and tries to protect her with his body as the rocks start to rain down -- TOWER FACE Hal lunges at Qualen, but is held back by Travers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (over radio, broken up)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come in, Frank --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there anybody else on the radio?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I take a year off and the department goes to hell. (keys it)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come in, Rescue Unit --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (via radio) Come in, Frank -- over -- QUALEN Try to get thirty million in entertainment out of this, because he is definitely in for thirty million worth of pain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You sick fuck -- QUALEN Don't worry. They may still be alive. That was the small one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Frank stops wheeling the gurney and looks up at the far-off blast, and the smoke, amazed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus -- that's some flare.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rocks tumble down it, filling it in and sealing it off -- FURTHER DOWN - GABE is braced over Maggie, protecting her from the first round of falling rocks, but rolling THUNDER in the crack announces that more is coming -- Gabe looks up as the noise gets closer -- ABOVE IN THE CRACK The rockslide arrives -- the crack is filled in seconds with rocks and dirt, packing it in -- Gabe tries to hold on, but is shoved down by the falling rocks -- Maggie, however, is buried in the crack as it fills -- GABE is knocked down to a point where the crack narrows -- he stops himself by jamming his body against the sides. Suddenly, it's quiet. A little dirt whistles through, but that's all. The cave-in has stopped, as it's filled in the crack above. And Maggie is in the middle of it.  Gabe unsheaths his ice axe and starts hacking up to get at Maggie. Dirt and rocks fall in his face as he digs -- BOMB NUMBER TWO - INSERT Another LED is counting down from 3:00 -- 2:59 -- 2:58 -- INSIDE THE CRACK Gabe frantically hacks at the ceiling of dirt -- rock and soil tumble down, but no sign of Maggie. Gabe uncovers one of Maggie's feet. Is it too late? Gabe digs up around her -- Maggie realizes Gabe is there -- she starts kicking. Finally Maggie tumbles out of the cave-in -- gasping and coughing, but alive.  Gabe catches her and brushes the dirt off her face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (terrified, coughing) Why are they doing this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Frank, having lain Evan's body to rest, runs back to the helicopter, starts it up and takes off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe is leading Maggie horizontally through the crack, fast and furious -- MAGGIE (looks up) We might be able to get up that way -- there's an opening -- GABE No -- there could be another bomb up there -- even if there isn't, we could get another cave-in. The only sure way out is through the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Treasury agents sift debris as Davis runs up to Stuart.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I've got something here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's have it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's an unconfirmed report of a distress call made from a plane that crashed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's really, really interesting, but
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gestures around)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: kind of old news, don't you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This call was supposedly made from a plane that crash landed. After it landed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (waves it off) Sounds like they got it wrong. Next time you interrupt my work make sure it's something I can use.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gabe and Maggie cautiously move along a single ledge -- finally, some light can be seen, thirty feet ahead, as they round a corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crack narrows, and Gabe straddles it, putting his feet on the opposite edge to walk faster. But before he can go on -- A HAND grabs one of Gabe's ankles from below and yanks him down -- Gabe tumbles painfully, braking himself in front of
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) Come on -- we're almost out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: bruised and bloody, who has survived the earlier fall and made his way out. His look is not a forgiving one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kynette smashes Gabe's face with a devastating, brass-knuckled punch -- GABE falls back, desperately grabbing at the walls to stop himself from going all the way down -- as he weakly tries to get up -- KYNETTE calmly opens his knife, and re-laces his fingers into its brass-knuckle handle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Miss me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The gang and Hal watch the mountain top, with very different expectations and hopes -- their vantage point keeps them from seeing where the crack actually comes out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (looks to Hal) You might say a few words for your friends -- this is the one that will bury them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - INSERT Ready to blow -- 0:10 -- 0:09 -- IN THE CRACK - MAGGIE can only look down helplessly at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fighting -- Gabe is on his feet, but Kynette, slashing at him with his knife, is forcing Gabe to back up -- the crack is getting wider, and finding footholds while crab-walking backwards in the dark isn't east. Gabe's in a rotten fighting position -- as he has to spread his feet out wider as he backs up, he's always lower than Kynette. Gabe throws a punch at Kynette's stomach, but there's no power to it. Kynette hits Gabe with a brutal knuckle-duster punch -- Gabe flies back several feet, somehow managing to straddle the crack walls -- which are now four feet apart. Kynette moves in for the kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INSERT The LED counts down -- 0:02 -- 0:01 -- 0:00 -- but doesn't detonate. A green light starts flashing, but the bomb hasn't gone off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kynette moves in over Gabe and swings down with the knife -- But Gabe grabs his knife hand, and adding his own force to the swing, imbeds the knife to the hilt in the rock wall, trapping Kynette's hand in the brass-knuckle handle. Gabe stabilizes himself on Kynette's trapped arm and gets a little payback -- three solid roundhouse punches to Kynette's face -- he then climbs up his pinned opponent, stepping up on Kynette's stuck hand as if it were a piton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Qualen's smirk is wiped off his face. The bomb didn't work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Qualen gestures helplessly, putting the radio in Hal's reach. Hal takes advantage of this, throws off Travers, and grabs the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the second Hal transmits -- BOMB NUMBER TWO detonates over the central part of the crevice, and as promised, it's even bigger than the first -- INSIDE THE CRACK The bomb instantly blasts tons of rock down the crevice -- GABE AND MAGGIE The RUMBLE of the approaching rockslide is unmistakable -- Gabe shoves Maggie forward -- GABE Move! Maggie doesn't have to be told twice -- she and Gabe move out the narrowed crack quickly, but under the circumstances, this "running" looks damn slow -- KYNETTE struggles with the stuck knife as the cave-in knocks him off the wall and buries him instantly -- GABE AND MAGGIE cover the last ten feet, shoved forward by an airburst from the giant explosion -- they make it to the crack's edge at last, but on the
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure -- I set the timer --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (keying radio) Gabe, it's a dud --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gabe and Maggie still have to cling desperately to the sheer wall -- the airburst has turned the crack into a wind tunnel -- it's as if the mountain were trying to blow them out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hal, shocked, stares at the enormity of the explosion. Qualen looks serenely satisfied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hal, stunned, looks at the radio, realizing Qualen tricked him into detonating the bomb. Travers, grinning, takes the radio from Hal and pats him on the back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: When I was seventeen, I was a sentry on the East Berlin boundary. There was a problem, then -- too many defectors were managing to sneak through the wilderness to the west. A man would take them through, every night of every week -- a man like your friend. (beat) He had quite a sense of humor. Every time he got someone through, he'd radio us at midnight to let us know how many. "Five tonight." "Eight more have been freed tonight." No one could find the route. It made me look bad. (beat) I looked day and night and finally I found it. A tunnel. I didn't tell me superiors. I put a charge there, with a timer to trigger a radio receiver on the detonator. At midnight. Our friend made his radio report, and I heard him say "seven" before the explosion. (beat) They pulled eight bodies out of the tunnel, and I was promoted to intelligence the next day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks. We couldn't have killed him without you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - ON THE WALL The force of the airburst, as brief as it is strong, is over. Dust slowly swirls out -- Gabe and Maggie raise their heads. Gabe looks back -- the crack is now sealed off. Gabe takes a piton and hammer from his belt and hands it to Maggie along with the rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie does as Gabe takes the binoculars out, and climbs out on a slim toehold so he can look up the wall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Knock this in the side. Make it firm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gabe whips the binoculars up to the top edge of the wall. It's blurry -- Gabe focuses the binoculars on -- the third bomb, visible on the mountain's edge. The LED counts down, but it's partly obscured. All Gabe can see is the seconds, not the minutes, that remain -- :42 -- :41 -- GABE (O.S.) Bad news. There's another bomb up there. We've got to move quick. Gabe scans methodically but rapidly down the rock below. All smooth. Until -- Gabe swings the binoculars back. There's a lip ninety feet below, leading into the wall. A cave.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Good news. There's a cave down there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: puts away the binoculars and swings back to Maggie -- she lets the length of rope drop. It's thirty feet long. Not even almost long enough to get to the shelter. Gabe leans against the crack wall, drained. Now what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MOVING OVER MOUNTAINS Frank is in the air, heading back out toward the range, frantically working the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TOWER FACE Frank's call is heard on the radio. Travers takes it, and takes charge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All scramble up towards the clearing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maggie -- come in, Maggie, this is Rescue One --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's our ride out of here. Everyone out of sight -- except you, Kristel. (hands her radio) Make the distress call. You're so good at it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We can see what Gabe couldn't -- the timer has about two minutes left -- 1:59 -- 1:58 -- GABE AND MAGGIE - AT THE CRACK'S EDGE Gabe looks completely defeated. Can't go up. Can't go back in. Can't go down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabe and Maggie fuse together in a tight embrace -- a final embrace. But Gabe opens his eyes as the rope, still in Maggie's hand, brushes his cheek. The end is frayed. Gabe's eyes light up. Inspiration. Gabe breaks off the embrace and snatches the rope from her -- he pulls at the end and furiously starts unravelling it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (frantic) What are we going to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (defeated) Die. I'm sorry, Maggie. I'm sorry you got into this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Davis has just filled in Wright on the "unconfirmed" distress call. Wright looks furious.

direction.raw_text: Hal hurls the clip, with its cloth "fuse" burning down, into the doorless side of the copter -- INSIDE THE HELICOPTER -- the makeshift bomb bounces to the floor of the cockpit -- Travers sees it and looks down, but -- THE "FUSE" sputters out -- nothing but glowing embers in the cloth -- TRAVERS smiles -- nothing to worry about -- he speeds ahead -- CLOSE ON THE HELICOPTER'S SKIDS as they slice through the top of the snow towards -- GABE as he runs toward the mountain's edge -- it's just a couple of feet ahead, but the copter is a couple of feet behind -- -- as the copter overtakes Gabe, dipping even lower into the snow, he dives off the edge -- FOLLOWING GABE - FALLING Gabe is at the ladder -- he falls the first twenty feet of the long drop, then grabs a rung on the cable ladder, very painfully stopping his fall -- but in the same split second -- THE HELICOPTER skid meant to impale Gabe catches the top two rungs of the cable ladder -- WIDE SHOT - THE HELICOPTER -- caught in the rungs of the cable ladder, the helicopter keeps flying out over the abyss, but as it pulls the cable ladder, it pops out the bolts that hold the ladder in place, rung by rung -- -- still going full tilt, the copter strains against the ladder -- thirty feet of it tethers the copter to the wall -- -- and Gabe is dangling from the center of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - GABE has one arm hooked around a rung, hanging on for his life as the copter thrashes the ladder up and down -- INSIDE THE COPTER Travers is disoriented by the jolt, and tries to maintain control -- he doesn't see -- -- that the cloth fuse on the ammo clip has reignited -- it burns down to the clip, and fifty rounds explode like a string of firecrackers -- -- Travers tries to shield himself as he is struck by airborne lead. Shrapnel blasts into the instrument panel -- THE HELICOPTER still strains against the cable ladder but the engine goes dead -- the rotor blades slow -- GABE ON LADDER Gabe stares in horror at the stalling rotor -- if it were possible for him to grip the ladder tighter, he'd do it now -- ON THE HELICOPTER -- as the rotor WHOPS to a dead halt the copter arcs down and slams against the mountain wall -- the skids are still caught in the ladder, and it holds -- GABE is shaken off by the massive impact -- he falls -- -- landing on the helicopter, half in and half out of the cockpit! As Gabe scrambles for a solid hold -- INT. HELICOPTER -- Travers, who has been shaken to the opposite side of the copter, reaches into his jacket and pulls out the pistol he took from Frank -- he aims at Gabe -- INSERT - THE HELICOPTER SKID One of the two rungs holding the copter up bursts -- THE HELICOPTER slips, now hanging from just a single rung -- -- and the impact of the slip makes Travers drop the gun -- it falls out the open passenger door. Travers scrambles up through the cabin to go after -- -- Gabe, who is trying to get off the helicopter and onto a solid part of the ladder before the whole thing goes down --           Gabe jumps for the wall as Travers scrambles behind him and -- CLOSE ON THE HELICOPTER SKID -- as the last rung supporting the copter snaps in two -- GABE grabs hold of the ladder as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: plummets down -- but as it starts its fall -- TRAVERS leaps from the falling copter and grabs Gabe's leg -- Gabe struggles to support both of them, but Travers, weakened from his wound, loses his grip on Gabe's leg -- he stares up in terror at Gabe as he clutches Gabe's snow-slick boot -- GABE Cheer up. It's a beautiful spot to die. Travers slides off and away -- THE FALL - LONG SHOT Travers SCREAMING as he free falls, trailing behind the helicopter -- we follow the entire four thousand foot drop -- -- until the helicopter explodes when it hits the ground far below, and the fireball engulfs Travers just before he impacts into the explosion!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks down at the burning wreck and clings to the ladder, closing his eyes for a moment in exhaustion. But the WHOPPING of another helicopter makes him look up -- THE TREASURY HELICOPTER has shown up, a little too late to be of any help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wright, Davis and Stuart look at the billowing flames of the wreck -- even from here, the burning money is visible, drifting up in the smoke. Wright turns to Stuart.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm no expert -- but what do you make of that "event"?
dialogue.name: dialogue
